text: oh yeah hi everyone Yatta Yatta the
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new Vivian
girls album memory rock trio Vivian
girls they're back five years after
they're announced break up in 2014 new
album once a humble band from New York
the Viv's became an overnight sensation
on the indie blogosphere after dropping
their self-titled record in 2008 also
gaining some pretty high praise from
established outfits such as pitchfork
and AV Club though I think the trio
sound was more ahead of the curve than
some people may have realized back in
2008 helping to set the table for some
pretty major trends in the indie scene
for the next five to six years meaning
they were there doing their thing before
loaf I became a sensation with waves
breaking onto the scene meaning they
were there before surf rock guitars
suddenly became a huge trend thanks to
groups such as Beach fossils and the
drums and if Vivian girls never existed
I fail to see how you get all this very
popular dreamy rough indie rock music
with a really strong feminine voice
whether it be best coast or dum-dum
girls or Frankie rose who played with
Vivian girls and you could even fast
forward to hear the band's influence on
newer groups whether it be conscious or
not such as Heinz now this is not to say
that the Vivian girls happen in a vacuum
that they didn't have their
contemporaries that they didn't have
their influences they most certainly did
artists like Jay and Black Lips
were already killing it at about the
time that they burst onto the scene and
the roots of low fight indie music go
all the way back to the 1980s but Vivian
girls base of inspiration spread out
much further than that into surf rock
and toot we into noise pop into sixties
girl groups and classic punk as I
remember it they were one of the few
bands around this time trying to
genuinely make the sounds of the Ramones
the Ronettes the ventures and the Jesus
and Mary Chain all coexist on the same
recording now sadly following this album
up the trio hit a bit of a sophomore
slump with very so-so record the music
scene was flooded with similar sounding
bands many of which had a larger
commercial appeal and by the time they
dropped their third full-length
album the band to clean their sound up
so much I think they started to lose
their original appeal even if it did
feature standout singles like heard you
say which is easily one of the best
tunes the Vivian girls have ever put out
the band took a few years past this
point to call it quits but now they're
back and it's a very odd time for a
return I mean the way that the trio
helped initiate is pretty much gone now
and if it doesn't have a trap beat
behind it the mainstream is pretty much
deaf to it as well as a good portion of
the underground the girls don't sound
like they're vying for wide appeal on
this one though it's more like they are
going back to their very noisy and
chaotic roots it's 2008 all over again
with the trio bringing that smudgy
blaring distorted sound they were once
known for but somehow on certain tracks
here it is heavier more distorted maybe
a bit thicker
especially on tracks like most of all
and sludge easily the most brooding song
the trio has ever put out the guitars on
this one are very fuzzy certainly live
up to the title of sludge most of this
album though does sound like you're
hearing the classic make up of Vivian
girls record all those noisy ringing
almost droning guitars just roaring and
roaring it sounds like what you would
get if you tried to make a Sun record
but with more of a surf rock guitar tone
and that sound that wall of sound is
basically a canvas for the trio to
Laysan all of these wintery chilly
strange vocal harmonies that are very
breathy very soft the drums especially
the snare just pierced through all that
noise and in the bass in the background
very quietly provides a groove
occasionally the trio reels it in a
little bit like on the track you're kind
of life where these demented warp
guitars scream away in the background
underneath some very clunky bass then
there's these strange metallic chime e
tones that dance on top of all of this
the sound is pretty twisted the song
itself is sour as hell but it offers
more clarity sonically than most of the
tracks here also comparing this record
to the group's earlier work while it is
noisy the
instrumentation the performances the way
everything syncs up it seems a lot more
methodically assembled the singing isn't
especially good in a traditional sense
though and can definitely hold a track
back if they are spotlit and not really
selling the song all that well namely on
the track lonely girl but for the most
part there are quite a few strong
highlights in the first leg of this
thing that seemed to build on the usual
Vivian girls blueprint like on the
opening track most of all as well as the
song something to do which has some of
the best momentum and chord changes on
the entire thing but for every track
like this that stands out there's
another that seems to house pretty much
the same sound the same aesthetic but
the tune at the core of it is just not
really all that good like add it again
or even the title track on this thing
which might even be the most half-baked
moment on this entire record and the
song all your promises is where and I
can't believe I'm saying this because
this is not usually a focal point of
Vivian girls music but the drums are
particularly lackluster here the
drumming is not usually like the best
thing about a Vivian girls track but it
is so tedious and sparse on this one
it's really just kind of the snare
providing most of the backbone when the
percussion could have been doing so much
more as this track has one of the most
gargantuan walls of guitar and waves of
any song here and it just really could
have used a bit more support a couple of
risks sludge that I mentioned earlier
super heavy super noisy also the song
I'm far away whose dark groovy bass
lines and drums and screaming washes of
guitar sounds like the soundtrack to a
goth doubt beach party I have my
criticisms of this record sure but I
didn't find any one track to be outright
terrible I just thought there were some
tracks quite a few that were
underwhelming quite a bit of this record
I think sounds very say me to those who
might not be all that into Vivian girls
incredibly noisy and increasingly
abrasive sound on this one I think this
is a definitely one of the gutsier
records in terms of harshness they've
put out so far and even though I do like
that quality in Vivian girls music I do
have to admit it does suffocate quite a
few of the songs here but I mostly feel
like this album is a pretty decent
comeback for the band hopefully they
continue to change things
up and right sharper songs and bring the
noise I'm feeling a strong six to a
light seven on this one transition have
